benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to payment

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios cover successful updates with 204 responses (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04).
Error Handling: Invalid paymentId format (TC05), not-found payment (TC06), missing required header (TC07), missing body (TC08), malformed JSON (TC09), invalid field data (TC10).
Edge Cases: Large payload (TC14), max length values (TC15), extra unexpected parameters (TC16).
Integration/Consistency: Data consistency check after update (TC17).
Performance/Stress: Concurrent requests (TC19), large payload size (TC20).
Regression/Existing Issues: Previously fixed issue with duplicates (TC18).
Payload Validations: Valid/invalid payload scenarios including missing/invalid body (TC08/TC09/TC10).
Header Variants: All optional headers tested in TC02 and required header in TC01/TC03/TC04.
gaps: Partial Update Behavior: No explicit test asserting whether partial updates are rejected or allowed (PUT typically full replace).
Concurrency Handling: No explicit race-condition tests beyond TC19 (no targeted contention checks on the same resource).
Pagination: Not applicable for a single resource update, but guideline mentions pagination for lists; no list operation tested here, so not a gap per se.
Caching/ETag: No tests validating caching headers or ETag behavior for this PUT endpoint.
recommendations: Add a test explicitly validating whether PUT performs a full replace vs partial update (to confirm API semantics).
Add a dedicated concurrency/race-condition scenario focusing on simultaneous updates to the same paymentId to detect race conditions.
Introduce tests around caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) for responses to PUT operations, even if 204, to validate caching behavior.
Consider a focused test for 403/401 nuances if roles/permissions differ beyond basic unauthorized (TC11).
Optional: add a test to verify idempotency of repeated PUTs with the same payload.
